page.title: 13The Calender life of a Farm
page.content: In the{summer months}my father who is a{farmer}starts making{silage.}Making silage is a busy job,tractors with trailers come whizzing into the yard revers into the shed to unload the trailer.My{father}then buckrakes the load into the back of the shed and then waits for the load.During the {autumn}my father prepares for the {winter.}He makes sure there is plenty of food for the{animals}to eat like {straw,cow-cake,silage}and{hay.}He has to change the cows bedding when it gets muddy.In the{winter}it is hard to get the cows into the milking cubicals because they keep on slipping on the ice.When we put{silage}out the tractor keeps on slipping.It was a difficult job because we could not go up the drive.In the{spring}cows give birth to thier young.The{calf}is coverd in slime when it is born.
